post_text: For the last couple of weeks, some of our equipment at Lemont High School has been working overtime! Twelve 3D printers from the makerspace in the CITGO Innovation Academy have made their way to homes of our faculty members, and the printers are working around the clock to print reusable protective masks for first responders. * Evan Schiffman (3rd, 120) and Mo Jarad (3rd, 285) earned their second and first state berths, respectively.

Shortly before noon today, Lemont High School was forced to evacuate due to a fire alarm. There was a sprinkler head issue in the cafeteria, but there was no fire. Students, faculty and staff were allowed to reenter the building once the Lemont Fire Department provided clearance to do so.

However, due to water in the cafeteria and the timing of the incident, we are unable to provide lunch to students in B, C and D lunches. Because of this, Lemont High School will dismiss early today at 12:50 p.m.

After school activities will go on at their regularly scheduled times.
